Package edu.se309.app.backend.socket

Class WebSocketServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.se309.app.backend.socket.WebSocketServer
  • @Component
public class WebSocketServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles communication between front end and backend using web sockets

    • Method Detail

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen​(javax.websocket.Session session,
                   java.lang.String username)
        Sets up and starts a websocket connection with the front end. Links the websocket up with an account based on the given username
        Parameters:
        session - The websocket session
        username - Username of the account

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage​(javax.websocket.Session session,
                      java.lang.String message)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Listens for messages and then directs the request to appropriate method
        Parameters:
        session - The websocket's sessions
        message - The message in the format "{full method name with parameter types}(...){parameter 1}-,-{parameter 2}-,-{parameter...}"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • noParametersMethodCall

        public void noParametersMethodCall​(java.lang.String message)
        Used for directing messages that require a method without a parameter
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be redirected. The message should only contain the full method name

      • parameterMethodCall

        public void parameterMethodCall​(java.lang.String message,
                                int indexOfSplit)
        Used for directing messages that require a method with parameter values
        Parameters:
        message - The message in the format "{full method name with parameter types}(...){parameter 1}-,-{parameter 2}-,-{parameter...}"
        indexOfSplit - the index where the parameters begin

      • onClose

        public void onClose()
        Closes the websocket

        Returns:
        the session associated with this websocket

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
